meta.hint:
Most verbs are regular in the past tense.
That means you follow a rule like 'add -ed' or 'add -d' to get the past-tense form of the verb.
Some verbs are irregular in the past tense. That means you don't follow a rule. Instead, you must remember the past-tense form of the verb.
Example - Luis did his homework. (Did is the irregular past-tense form of do.)
meta.question: Select the sentence with correct Example - irregular past tense.

content.word: She ate dinner with her family.
content.description: Which sentence is in the past tense?
content.extra: She ate dinner with her family.,She eats dinner with her family.

content.word: I felt she is hiding something.
content.description: Which sentence is in the past tense?
content.extra: I feel she is hiding something,I felt she is hiding something.
